title: Set de Ejercicios Mixtos 1 - Gramática y Vocabulario
description: Ejercicios variados que combinan gramática (obligación, preferencias, make/do, deducciones) y vocabulario (adjetivos descriptivos, phrasal verbs, palabras confusas, vocabulario laboral).

questions.question: Choose the correct modal to express a strong deduction:

answerOptions.text: She must be at home - her car is in the driveway.
answerOptions.rationale: 'Must' expresa deducción lógica basada en evidencia clara.

answerOptions.text: She might be at home - her car is in the driveway.
answerOptions.rationale: 'Might' expresa menos certeza de la que sugiere la evidencia.

answerOptions.text: She can't be at home - her car is in the driveway.
answerOptions.rationale: 'Can't' contradiría la evidencia presentada.

questions.hint: La evidencia es muy clara, ¿qué modal expresa alta certeza?

questions.question: Complete with the correct phrasal verb:
questionParts: my work after being sick for a week.
questions.hint: 'Catch up with' significa ponerse al día o alcanzar algo que se había atrasado.

questions.question: Which sentence expresses a strong preference?

answerOptions.text: I'd rather stay home tonight than go out.
answerOptions.rationale: 'Would rather' expresa preferencia fuerte entre dos opciones.

answerOptions.text: I like staying home tonight.
answerOptions.rationale: Esto expresa gusto, no preferencia comparativa.

answerOptions.text: I want to stay home tonight.
answerOptions.rationale: Expresa deseo, no preferencia entre opciones.

questions.hint: Busca la estructura que compare dos opciones.

questions.question: The word 'exhausted' means slightly tired.
questions.explanation: 'Exhausted' significa extremadamente cansado, no ligeramente cansado. Para 'slightly tired' usaríamos 'a bit tired' o simplemente 'tired'.

answerOptions.text: I need to make a decision about my career.
answerOptions.rationale: 'Make a decision' es la expresión correcta con 'make'.

answerOptions.text: I need to do a decision about my career.
answerOptions.rationale: No se usa 'do' con 'decision'. Se dice 'make a decision'.

answerOptions.text: I need to take a decision about my career.
answerOptions.rationale: Aunque se usa en algunos contextos, 'make a decision' es más común.

questions.question: What's the difference between 'salary' and 'income'?

answerOptions.text: Salary is fixed monthly payment; income includes all money received.
answerOptions.rationale: Salary es el pago fijo de un trabajo; income incluye todas las fuentes de dinero.

answerOptions.text: They mean exactly the same thing.
answerOptions.rationale: Tienen significados diferentes aunque relacionados.

answerOptions.text: Income is only for employees; salary is for everyone.
answerOptions.rationale: Es al revés: salary es específico para empleados.

questions.hint: Piensa en cuál es más específico y cuál es más general.

questions.question: You must wear a helmet when riding a motorcycle - this expresses obligation.
questions.explanation: 'Must' aquí expresa obligación legal o regulatoria, especialmente en contextos de seguridad.

questions.question: Choose the correct adjective for extreme hunger:

answerOptions.text: I'm starving! I haven't eaten all day.
answerOptions.rationale: 'Starving' expresa hambre extrema, mucho más fuerte que 'hungry'.

answerOptions.text: I'm hungry! I haven't eaten all day.
answerOptions.rationale: 'Hungry' es normal, pero el contexto sugiere hambre extrema.

answerOptions.text: I'm full! I haven't eaten all day.
answerOptions.rationale: 'Full' significa satisfecho, lo opuesto de tener hambre.

questions.hint: ¿Qué adjetivo expresa el grado más extremo de hambre?

questions.question: Choose the correct negative deduction:

answerOptions.text: That can't be John - he's in London this week.
answerOptions.rationale: 'Can't' expresa deducción negativa con alta certeza.

answerOptions.text: That mustn't be John - he's in London this week.
answerOptions.rationale: 'Mustn't' expresa prohibición, no deducción negativa.

answerOptions.text: That might not be John - he's in London this week.
answerOptions.rationale: 'Might not' expresa poca certeza, pero la evidencia es clara.

questions.hint: ¿Qué modal expresa imposibilidad o deducción negativa fuerte?

questions.question: Complete with the work-related noun:

answerOptions.text: To investigate and study a topic systematically.
answerOptions.rationale: 'Do research' significa investigar de manera sistemática.

answerOptions.text: To create or build something new.
answerOptions.rationale: Eso sería 'make' algo, no 'do research'.

answerOptions.text: To teach about a subject.
answerOptions.rationale: Enseñar sería 'teach' o 'give lessons'.

questions.question: 'Delighted' expresses a stronger emotion than 'happy'.
questions.explanation: 'Delighted' expresa gran placer o satisfacción, es más intenso que 'happy'. Es similar a 'thrilled' o 'overjoyed'.

questions.hint: Después de 'would rather' se usa el infinitivo sin 'to'.

questions.question: Which is the correct expression?

answerOptions.text: She has a confused look on her face.
answerOptions.rationale: 'Look' se refiere a la expresión facial de una persona.

answerOptions.text: She has a confused expression on her face.
answerOptions.rationale: Aunque 'expression' es correcto, 'look' es más común en este contexto.

answerOptions.text: Both are equally correct.
answerOptions.rationale: Aunque ambas son gramaticalmente correctas, 'look' es más natural.

questions.hint: ¿Qué palabra usamos más comúnmente para la expresión facial?

questions.question: What's the noun form of the verb 'develop'?
questions.explanation: 'Development' es el sustantivo derivado de 'develop', muy usado en contextos profesionales.

questions.question: Complete: You _____ see a doctor about that cough.

answerOptions.text: had better
answerOptions.rationale: 'Had better' expresa consejo fuerte o advertencia sobre salud.

answerOptions.text: would rather
answerOptions.rationale: 'Would rather' expresa preferencia, no consejo médico.

answerOptions.text: might better
answerOptions.rationale: 'Might better' no es una estructura correcta en inglés.

questions.hint: ¿Qué estructura se usa para dar consejos fuertes sobre salud?

questions.hint: Usa 'must have' + participio pasado para deducciones sobre el pasado.

questions.question: 'Huge' is more intense than 'big'.
questions.explanation: 'Huge' expresa un tamaño mucho mayor que 'big'. Es similar a 'enormous' o 'gigantic'.

questions.question: Students _____ do their homework every night.

answerOptions.text: have to
answerOptions.rationale: 'Have to' expresa obligación externa (regla escolar).

answerOptions.text: would rather
answerOptions.rationale: 'Would rather' expresa preferencia, no obligación.

answerOptions.text: had better
answerOptions.rationale: 'Had better' es para consejos/advertencias, no reglas escolares.

questions.hint: ¿Qué modal expresa obligación impuesta por reglas externas?
